people_also_ask.heading: six courses
people_also_ask.heading2: It is a platform game in which the player must guide a marble through six courses, populated with obstacles and enemies, within a time limit.
people_also_ask.title: Marble Madness - Wikipedia

people_also_ask.heading: Marble Madness is played from an isometric third-person perspective. The object of the game is to maneuver a colored marble through several different courses in the constraints of a time limit. Each ends when the marble reaches an end goal (marked “GOAL”).
people_also_ask.title: Marble Madness - Play CLASSIC games online

people_also_ask.title: Marble Madness inspired Marble Void rolls on to Xbox One

people_also_ask.heading: Marble Madness was a game released to the NES and Game Boy in 1989 and 1991 respectively. It involved navigating a marble through increasingly complex mazes within a specified time limit.

knowledge_panel.description: marble madness is an arcade video game designed by mark cerny and published by atari games and midway games in 1984. it is a platform game in which the player must guide a marble through six courses, populated with obstacles and enemies, within a time limit. the player controls the marble by using a trackball. wikipedia
